page.title: 14The Village Fete
page.content: The annual village fetes in Walkern & Ardeley are highlights of the year for the local community. Both are very local affairs with a long tradition & are well supported. Money raised is used for church maintenance & supports a wide range of village activities. The Ardeley fete is always held on the village green on the last Saturday in June. The men of the village set up stalls & competitions with tractors, balers & ladders & the ladies prepare the teas in the village hall. In the absence of a local celebrity, the proceedings are opened by the vicar. Stalls & competitions are traditional & unvaried (tombola, quoits, horseshoe throwing). Innovation is not encouraged. Consumption of scones, & cakes is epic. Anybody without a job sells raffle tickets & by 6pm the fund will have benefited by around Â£800.
